item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Saturday, May 17, 2025 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Senior devs aren't just faster, they can dodge problems juniors are forced to solve ( points | 8 comments)
2. Evolution of Rust compiler errors ( points | 11 comments)
3. A Ledger In PostgreSQL Is Fast ( points | no comments)
4. GNU Parallel Examples ( points | 13 comments)
5. Classical "Single user computers" were a flawed or at least limited idea ( points | 19 comments)
6. Jetrelay: A high-performance ATproto relay in 500 LOC ( points | 3 comments)
7. New Life Hack: Using LLMs to Generate Constraint Solver Programs for Personal Logistics Tasks ( points | 5 comments)
8. What Problems are Truly Technical, not Social? ( points | 9 comments)
9. Deep Dive on New Combinators ( points | 9 comments)
10. Using unwrap() in Rust is Okay ( points | 1 comment)
11. Don’t Use ISO/IEC 14977 Extended Backus-Naur Form (EBNF) (2019, 2023) ( points | 3 comments)
12. A coherent European/non-US cloud strategy: building railroads for the cloud economy ( points | 7 comments)
13. My favourite fonts to use with LaTeX (2022) ( points | 4 comments)
14. OCaml Web Development: Essential Tools and Libraries in 2025 ( points | 1 comment)
15. Teal: a statically-typed dialect of Lua ( points | 9 comments)
16. My 2025 high-end Linux PC ( points | 74 comments)
17. Announcing Rust 1.87.0 and ten years of Rust ( points | 17 comments)
18. I don’t like NumPy ( points | 6 comments)
19. Detecting malicious Unicode ( points | no comments)
20. Mutexes Are Faster Than Spinlocks ( points | no comments)
21. A leap year check in three instructions ( points | 2 comments)
22. erlang-red: Visual low-code flow-based programming environment for Erlang, inspired by Node-RED ( points | 1 comment)
23. What are you doing this weekend? ( points | 16 comments)
24. Pallene: a statically typed ahead-of-time compiled sister language to Lua, with a focus on performance ( points | 1 comment)
25. Leeks and leaks ( points | 1 comment)
